wikipedia_page.main: Anthony Neuberger is an academic in the United Kingdom, currently Professor of Finance at Cass Business School. Neuberger has previously held senior positions at other academic institutions including Warwick Business School and London Business School.

response: Neuberger married professor Anthony Neuberger on 17 September 1973.Anthony Neuberger profile from Warwick Business School  They have a son named Matthew and a daughter named Harriet. Anthony is the son of professor Albert Neuberger and the brother of professors Michael and James Neuberger, as well as the brother of former UK Supreme Court President David Neuberger.

He married Lilian Ida Dreyfus in 1943 and was the father of James Neuberger, David Neuberger, Baron Neuberger of Abbotsbury, Anthony Neuberger, Professor of Finance, University of Warwick, Michael Neuberger and Janet Neuberger. He was also the brother of Rabbi Herman Neuberger.

He is the son of Prof. Albert Neuberger, the brother of Prof. Michael Neuberger, Prof. Anthony Neuberger, and David Neuberger, Baron Neuberger of Abbotsbury (President of the Supreme Court of the United Kingdom), and the brother-in-law of Julia Neuberger.

link_mentions.page: David Neuberger, Baron Neuberger of Abbotsbury
response: Neuberger was born on 10 January 1948, the son of Albert Neuberger,  Professor of Chemical Pathology at St Mary's Hospital, University of London, and his wife, Lilian. His uncle was the noted rabbi Herman N. Neuberger. All three of his brothers are or were professors: James Neuberger is Professor of Medicine at the University of Birmingham, Michael Neuberger was Professor of Molecular Immunology at the University of Cambridge, while Anthony Neuberger is Professor in Finance at Warwick Business School, University of Warwick.

In 1976, Neuberger married Angela Holdsworth, the TV producer and writer. They have three children, Jessica, Nicholas and Max, who are all solicitors. Neuberger's sister-in-law, through his brother Anthony Neuberger, is Julia Neuberger, Baroness Neuberger, Senior Rabbi of the West London Synagogue.

Julia Schwab, who married Professor Anthony Neuberger, is Britain's second female Rabbi (serving at the South London Liberal Synagogue from 1977 to 1989). A former member of the Social Democratic Party, she stood unsuccessfully for Tooting in 1983. She was later ennobled in 2004, sitting with the Liberal Democrats, but joined the Crossbenches after being appointed Senior Rabbi at the West London Synagogue in 2011. Her brother-in-law was appointed a Lord of Appeal in Ordinary in 2005, and later served as President of the new Supreme Court of the United Kingdom (analogous to the position of Senior Law Lord).
** Professor Anthony Neuberger = 15px Rabbi Julia Babette Sarah Neuberger, Baroness Neuberger née Schwab (b. 1950)
